abstract: Republican-dominated Missouri legislature passes gun rights bill enabling people to carry concealed firearms without permit and loosening restrictions on self-defense; opponents predict measure will promote murder and provokes racial tensions.
lead_paragraph: The measure, which now goes to Gov. Jay Nixon for his signature, would allow people to carry concealed guns without permits.

headline.main: Missouri Lawmakers Pass Sweeping Gun Rights Expansion
headline.print_headline: Missouri Lawmakers Pass Gun Rights Bill

snippet: The measure, which now goes to Gov. Jay Nixon for his signature, would allow people to carry concealed guns without permits.
